content.title: String Theory at the Planck Scale: Strings, Minimum Length, and Extra Dimensions
content.abstract: String theory replaces point particles with one-dimensional extended objects (strings) of characteristic length ℓ_s ~ ℓ_P. This leads to a natural UV cutoff, a minimum length ~ ℓ_s, and dramatically different physics at the Planck scale including extra dimensions, T-duality, and a landscape of possible vacua.

statement.text: In string theory, the fundamental objects are not point particles but one-dimensional strings of length ℓ_s = √(α') ~ ℓ_P. This extended nature provides a natural ultraviolet cutoff, eliminates point-particle divergences, and leads to a minimum measurable length ~ ℓ_s. T-duality (R ↔ α'/R) makes physics at scales smaller than ℓ_s equivalent to physics at scales larger than ℓ_s, effectively removing sub-Planckian physics.
statement.string_length: ℓ_s = √(α') = √(2πℏ/T) where T is string tension
statement.relation_to_planck: ℓ_s = g_s^(1/4)·ℓ_P (in Type II strings) where g_s is string coupling
statement.t_duality: Physics at radius R is equivalent to physics at radius α'/R
statement.minimum_length: Δx ≥ ℓ_s—strings cannot probe distances smaller than their own length

explanation.intuition: Imagine replacing every point particle with a tiny vibrating string, like a guitar string but 10⁻³⁵ meters long. Different vibration modes correspond to different particles—one mode gives an electron, another a photon, another a graviton. Because strings are extended objects, they can't probe distances smaller than their own length ℓ_s. It's like trying to see details smaller than your measuring stick. This 'blurring' eliminates the infinities that plague point-particle physics and provides a natural minimum length.
explanation.key_insight: The most remarkable feature is T-duality: if you wrap a string around a circle of radius R, the physics is identical to wrapping it around a circle of radius ℓ_s²/R. This means R < ℓ_s is equivalent to R' > ℓ_s—there's no new physics below the string scale! Sub-Planckian distances don't really exist in string theory; they're 'dual' to super-Planckian distances. This is a profound realization: the very notion of 'smaller than ℓ_s' loses meaning.
explanation.technical_details: String length: ℓ_s = √(α') where α' = 1/(2πT) is the Regge slope, T is string tension. In natural units: ℓ_s = 1/M_s where M_s is string mass scale. Relation to Planck scale depends on string coupling g_s and number of large dimensions. For weakly coupled Type II strings: ℓ_s = g_s^(1/4)·ℓ_P. For heterotic strings: ℓ_s ~ ℓ_P·√(α_GUT). String spectrum: E_n = √(n/α') for oscillator modes. Minimum mass ~ M_s unless supersymmetric ground state. Graviton is massless closed string mode. T-duality: For compact dimension of radius R, spectrum E² = (n/R)² + (mR/α')² + oscillators, where n is momentum mode, m is winding mode. Under R → α'/R: n ↔ m, so physics unchanged. This is an exact symmetry in perturbative string theory. Minimum probed distance: ΔxΔp ≥ ℏ plus string spreading Δx ≥ α'E/ℏ gives Δx_min ~ ℓ_s. High-energy string scattering: cross section grows with energy σ ~ α'E², unlike point-particle decrease σ ~ 1/E². UV divergences absent: string worldsheet replaces point-particle worldline; modular invariance ensures UV finiteness.
common_misconceptions: WRONG: 'Strings are definitely ℓ_P long' — ℓ_s can differ from ℓ_P by factors depending on coupling
WRONG: 'String theory is proven' — It's a framework; specific predictions depend on unknown compactification
WRONG: 'Extra dimensions must be ℓ_P sized' — They could be as large as millimeters (ADD scenario)
WRONG: 'T-duality means space is discrete' — It's an equivalence, not discretization
CORRECT: 'Strings provide natural UV cutoff' — Extended objects smooth out point-particle singularities

string_length.definition: Characteristic length of string, sets the scale of extended nature
string_length.typical_value: ~ ℓ_P in strongly coupled regime; may differ by orders of magnitude otherwise
string_length.physical_meaning: Minimum resolution scale; distances < ℓ_s are probed by winding modes, not momentum modes

regge_slope.definition: Inverse of string tension times 2π: α' = 1/(2πT)
regge_slope.role: Sets mass scale: M_n = √(n/α'), relates energy to size

t_duality.statement: Physics at radius R equals physics at radius α'/R
t_duality.consequence: No physics at R < ℓ_s that isn't already captured at R > ℓ_s
t_duality.mechanism: Momentum modes (n/R) and winding modes (mR/α') exchange roles

string_tension.definition: Energy per unit length of string

string_coupling.definition: Dimensionless parameter controlling string interaction strength
string_coupling.origin: Vacuum expectation value of dilaton field
string_coupling.importance: Determines which regime (weak/strong coupling) is reliable

physical_predictions.mechanism: Extended nature of strings prevents sub-string probing
physical_predictions.status: Not directly tested; consistent with GUP phenomenology

physical_predictions.description: Massless spin-2 particle emerges naturally from closed string spectrum
physical_predictions.status: Remarkable theoretical result; no direct test

physical_predictions.compactification: Extra dimensions must be compact (small) or we'd see them
physical_predictions.observation: No evidence for extra dimensions at LHC
physical_predictions.future: Could appear at higher energies or through gravity experiments

physical_predictions.description: String cross sections grow with energy: σ ~ α'E²
Excited string modes have masses M_n = √(n)M_s
physical_predictions.spectrum: Hagedorn tower of exponentially growing number of states

large_extra_dimensions.size: Extra dimensions up to ~ mm (for 2 extra dims)
large_extra_dimensions.consequence: String scale could be ~ TeV, accessible at LHC
large_extra_dimensions.status: Not observed at LHC; constrained but not ruled out

warped_extra_dimensions.mechanism: Exponential warping creates hierarchy between scales
warped_extra_dimensions.status: Constrained by LHC; specific versions ruled out

string_vs_planck.general: ℓ_s = g_s^a · ℓ_P where a depends on string theory type
string_vs_planck.extreme_cases: In some scenarios, ℓ_s >> ℓ_P (low string scale)

planck_mass_vs_string_mass.implication: String and Planck scales coincide only for g_s ~ 1

gravitational_strength.interpretation: Gravity strength determined by string coupling and length

open_problems: Landscape problem: 10⁵⁰⁰ possible vacua—which one is ours?
Moduli stabilization: What fixes extra dimension sizes?
Supersymmetry breaking: How is SUSY broken at low energies?
Cosmological constant: Why is vacuum energy so small?
Predictions: What unique, testable prediction does string theory make?
Non-perturbative definition: What is the complete theory?

definitions_glossary.string_theory: Framework where fundamental objects are 1D strings, not point particles
definitions_glossary.string_length: ℓ_s = √(α'), characteristic size of fundamental strings
definitions_glossary.t_duality: Symmetry exchanging small and large compact dimensions: R ↔ α'/R
definitions_glossary.extra_dimensions: Spatial dimensions beyond 3+1, required by string consistency
definitions_glossary.string_coupling: g_s, dimensionless parameter controlling interaction strength
definitions_glossary.compactification: Process of making extra dimensions small/compact
definitions_glossary.hagedorn_temperature: Maximum temperature ~ M_s where string states proliferate
definitions_glossary.landscape: Large set (10⁵⁰⁰+) of possible string theory vacua

Explain how extended strings provide UV cutoff
Describe T-duality and its implication for minimum length
Compare string theory to loop quantum gravity approach

common_errors: Assuming ℓ_s = ℓ_P exactly—they can differ by coupling factors
Thinking extra dimensions are proven—they're theoretical requirements
physics_insights: String length ℓ_s = √(α') provides natural UV cutoff
T-duality: R ↔ α'/R makes sub-string physics equivalent to super-string
Graviton emerges naturally as closed string mode
Extra dimensions needed for consistency: 10D or 26D
String and Planck scales related by coupling: ℓ_s = g_s^a ℓ_P
